intro: Scorzonera humilis subf. nana, commonly known as the alpine scorzonera, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its tuberous roots are notable for their edible qualities, though the plant is more often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Scorzonera humilis subf. nana is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
